answers.a: Limit up to which the necking begins.
answers.b: Limit up to which the material breaks.
answers.c: Limit up to which the Hooke's law is valid.
answers.d: Limit up to which the stress is proportional to strain

explanations.e: Proportionality limit is where till the hookes law is valid and stress is directly proportional to the strain.

questions.question: 2. The elastic limit of a material is _____________

answers.a: the least amount of stress that can be held without permanent deformation
answers.b: highest stress a material can experience without permanent deformation
answers.c: average stress experienced by material in its lifeline.

explanations.b: The elastic limit is the highest stress that a material can withstand, without permanent deformation present when the stress is released completely. It is not the lowest amount of stress present.

questions.question: 3. True stress-strain curve for materials is plotted between.

answers.a: load/original cross-sectional area and change in length/original length
answers.b: load/instantaneous cross-sectional area and log(length/original length)
answers.c: load/instantaneous cross-sectional area and change in length/original length
answers.d: load/instantaneous cross-sectional area and instantaneous area/ original area.

explanations.c: Ultimate strength is property of material , the change in dimension does not affect the ultimate strength.

questions.question: 4. The tensile test is carried on __________ materials.

explanations.a: The brittle materials are weak in tension. The malleable materials are to be hammered into thin sheets. The plasticity is a property where there will be huge strain with almost slight application of load. The tensile test is conducted on the ductile materials.

questions.question: 5. Extensometer is a device that  measures change in length to the gage length.
